title: Calumny arraign'd and cast. Or A briefe answer to some extravagant and rank passages, lately fallen from the pen of William Prynne, Esquire, in a late discourse, entituled, Truth triumphing over falshood, &c. against Mr John Goodwin, Minister of the Gospel. Wherein the loyall, unfeigned and unstained affection of the said John Goodwin to the Parliament, and civill magistracie, is irrefragably and fully vindicated and asserted against those broad and unchristian imputations, most untruly suggested in the said discourse against him. By the said John Goodvvin. Licensed entered and printed according to order.
author: Goodwin, John, 1594?-1665.
publisher: Printed by M. Simmons for Henry Overton, and are to be sold at his shop in Popes-head-Alley,
notes: Annotation on Thomason copy: "Jan: 31st"; the 5 in imprint date is crossed out and altered to 1644.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
